text: Horsfieldia iryaghedhi is a species of plant in the family Myristicaceae. It is endemic to Sri Lanka. ==Culture== Known as "ruk - රුක්" in Sinhala. In Theravada Buddhism, this plant is said to have used as the tree for achieved enlightenment, or Bodhi by sixteenth Lord Buddha called "Piyadassi - පියදස්සි". The plant is known as කුකුධ (Kukudha) in Sanskrit. ==References== * World Conservation Monitoring Centre 1998. Horsfieldia iryaghedhi. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species.
